content.rendered:
The Volkswagen brand is a household name the world over and often conjures up images of small prestige Euro cars that can pack a punch. Let us take a comprehensive look at Volkswagen and everything this European powerhouse has to offer, including; the company origins, the benefits of owning a Volkswagen, popular models and Volkswagen servicing.

There is a reason it is referred to as ‘The People’s Car’ as they have something to offer everyone, from small commuter cars to high performance cars for those seeking thrills. If you are a proud Volkswagen owner, keep reading as we will provide you with all the important information to keep your beloved vehicle in top notch condition.

The Origins of Volkswagen

Volkswagen Group is a major German automobile manufacturer that was founded by the German Government in 1937 to produce an affordable car for everyone. Their headquarters are based out of Wolfsburg, Germany where they have been doing business since 1948 and producing cars for over 70 years!

Production for Volkswagen expanded quickly through the 1950s when it introduced the iconic ‘Transporter Van’ and Beetle. As competition increased domestically and internationally, Volkswagen made the move to small cars with a more modern design that had the engine in the front of the car, this gave rise to the ever so popular Volkswagen Golf, with the Golf becoming an instant success across the globe and a worldwide best seller.

Volkswagen has since expanded their line introducing the Passat shortly after, the even smaller Polo model, Tiguan SUV and the Caddy van. In 1975, the company established the GTI line that catered to car enthusiasts who were seeking a little more zip in their daily commuter. Following the success of the GTI line, Volkswagen developed the R range which took performance to the next level, putting the Volkswagen Golf in competition with some serious sports cars such as BMW and Mercedes.

Following its world wide success, the Volkswagen company ultimately became the Volkswagen group now comprising ten brands which include: Volkswagen, Volkswagen Commercial Vehicles, SKODA, SEAT, CUPRA, Audi, Lamborghini, Bentley, Porsche and Ducati.

(That’s an impressive list of car brands, if we do say ourselves)

So what makes Volkswagen cars so great?

The Benefits of Owning a Volkswagen

Once again, Volkswagen is not referred to as ‘The People’s Car’ without reason, and boasts a number of prestigious accolades throughout its history including winning countless ‘Car of the Year’ awards since their inception. With this in mind, let’s have a look at some of the many benefits of owning a Volkswagen.

High Quality Build

If you want a car that will stand the test of time due to its high-quality then look no further than Volkswagen. Volkswagen have been manufacturing great models for many decades now and are well known for having vehicles on the road well after production has ended. Some examples include the Beetle, Kombi van and Golf. It goes without saying how durable these cars are since most people consider them timeless classics – perfect if your goal also includes owning a classic that performs.

Performance

Amongst their daily commuters, Volkswagen provides thrill seekers the options to have sophistication and sports performance in one car. The Volkswagen R Range has a powerful turbocharged petrol engine under the hood, offering outstanding power and torque as well as luxury and comfort at the same time.

Great Resale Value

With great build quality and performance comes great resale value. Volkswagens are notorious for their ability to hold their value on the used car market which is a great plus for any owner regardless of how long they have owned their car for. So when it is time to let your Volkswagen go, you know you will be in a good position to sell and upgrade to the latest model.

Reliability

With Volkswagens being in production since the early 1900s you can feel assured that you are in a reliable and time tested vehicle. Think of this – Volkswagen’s engines were even used in the military! That’s true reliability. It is often said that if a Volkswagen engine receives the car servicing and auto repairs it requires it could last a lifetime, which leads to an important question. What does Volkswagen servicing in Sydney involve?

Volkswagen Service

Just like anything else, it is important to take good care of your Volkswagen by taking it in for a regular Volkswagen service at an authorised Volkswagen service centre. A regular Volkswagen service ensures that your car is performing at its best and will reduce the likelihood of expensive problems or repairs for you down the line.

A Typical Volkswagen Service in Sydney Involves

  • Oil Checks
  • Brakes
  • Transmission
  • Wheels and Tyres
  • Suspension & Steering
  • Logbook Servicing
  • Tune Up
  • Fuel Injection System
  • Car Battery 
  • Air Conditioning

Benefits of Regular Volkswagen Servicing

  • Improved performance – by having all of your car components maintained you will have a better driving experience
  • Increased safety – with regular servicing and inspections your cars safety features and any minor issues will be identified and rectified 
  • Financial savings – paying for regular servicing will save your more in the long run by maintaining the health of the engine and minimising any bigger issues 
  • Improved fuel efficiency – a healthy engine means better engine combustion leading to improved fuel economy. With recent petrol price increases this is an important one!
  • Higher resale value – a car with regular log book servicing is always appealable to a buyer which means your car will be valued higher

Independent Logbook Servicing 

There is an outdated myth that you must take your car to a Volkswagen dealership to have your Volkswagen service done, or you will void your warranty, thankfully this is not the case and you can take your car to an independent Volkswagen service centre such as VAR Automotive, and NOT void your warranty.

The truth is that servicing performed at independent car servicing centres are more in depth and cover a wider scope than servicing provided at a dealership or manufacturers. You will also receive more flexible options and better pricing.

Volkswagen Servicing at VAR Automotive

With their long history of producing quality cars, the Volkswagen is a favourite among drivers and performance enthusiasts, however as with any vehicle there are things you need to keep an eye on in order for your car to run as smoothly and safely as possible. Regular car servicing or repairs is a must, so be sure to visit one of VAR Automotive’s Volkswagen service centres in Vaucluse or Woolloomooloo for your Volkswagen service in Sydney. Don’t forget to ask about our courtesy vehicle for added convenience.

CALL US CALL US
BOOK AN INSPECTION BOOK AN INSPECTION
